result.execSummary:
All charges against Edward P. Peterson in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Edward P. Peterson is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward P. Peterson

records.addlTxt:
1:30PM Defendant Edward P. Peterson in court.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied. Attorney Tlusty indicated that she had a pretrial conference with defendant and defendant indicated that he wants an attorney.  Court inquires of the defendant of what he wants to do next in his case.  Defendant indicated that he would like to hire an attorney.
Status hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Status hearing on October 17, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Status hearing on August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.
Status hearing on July 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall have no contact with K.J.V. - dob:  8-30-1990.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall have no contact with K.J.V. - dob:  8-30-1990.

01:46 PM Defendant Edward P. Peterson in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim notification has been complied.  Court advises defendant of charges and penalties.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Court enters a plea of not guilty on defendant's behalf.  Court orders a $350.00 signature bond and $150.00 cash bond; booking; no contact with K.J.V. - dob:  8-30-1990.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Status hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 10:00 am. - rt
